question: Among the following who was the proponent of the ‘Bhakti Cult’ from West Bengal?
explanation:
Chaitnya mahaprabhu was one of the greatest saints of bhakti movement, from West Bengal. His childhood name was nimai or Biswambar mishra. He was popularly known as Gauranga Mahaprabhu. The main features of bhakti movement by him were:
• A loving relationship between a devotee and his personal god
• Bhakti emphasised devotion and individual worship of a god or goodess rather than performance of elaborate sacrifices
• Discarding of any discrimination based on gender, caste or creed
